intro: Gastrolobium capitatum, commonly known as the yellow bush wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its yellow flowers and shrub-like growth habit. The plant has compound leaves and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain seeds. It is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Gastrolobium capitatum is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen, which benefits soil fertility.
